title: Competency Enhancement Program for Addressing Unexpected Mathematical Instructional Situations

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: A program for current corporate training professionals to develop the capacity to prepare for unpredictable situations in mathematics education using the DUE methodology

learning_goals: Learners can identify five or more unpredictable situations that may occur during math classes and design strategies to respond to them.
Learners can reconstruct math education scenarios by applying the five DUE methodology strategies: modularity, prediction, layering, redundancy, and deviation.
Learners can analyze case studies of exceptional situations in real classroom environments and suggest improvements through post-hoc reflection.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
